meanings.definition: To study the history and origin of words.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys etymologizing to learn where words come from.
meanings.sent2: Linguists spend hours etymologizing to understand word origins.
meanings.sent3: The children found etymologizing words surprisingly fun.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for etymologizing words is like unraveling a mystery.
meanings.sent5: Etymologizing makes the stories behind words come alive.

meanings.definition: To analyze the roots and development of language.
meanings.sent1: He is etymologizing the language to see how it evolved.
meanings.sent2: Researchers etymologize to uncover the secrets of language growth.
meanings.sent3: The students giggled while etymologizing the ancient words.
meanings.sent4: Etymologizing language is like peeling back layers of history.
meanings.sent5: Etymologizing reveals the hidden journey of language.

meanings.definition: The act of tracing the history of words.
meanings.sent1: His etymologizing of words is thorough and detailed.
meanings.sent2: The book provides a fascinating look into the world of etymologizing.
meanings.sent3: The etymologizing of old sayings can be quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: In literature, etymologizing adds a rich layer of understanding.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of etymologizing lies in uncovering linguistic tales.
